item.title: Running many t-tests
item.description: Suppose you have an expression dataset, and want to run t-tests for several genes/probes comparing two conditions. We can use tidyverse concepts to do this. First, letâ€™s get some data. library(tidyverse) library(broom) library(affy) # BiocManager::install('affydata') data(Dilution, package = 'affydata') eset <- mas5(Dilution) # pre-proccessing ## background correction: mas ## PM/MM correction : mas ## expression values: mas ## background correcting...done. ## 12625 ids to be processed ## | | ## |####################| dat <- exprs(eset) # extract expressions Dat <- as.
